page.title: 02THE CASTLE.
page.content: One of the most impressive buildings in Wisbech is the Castle.It is to be found in the centre of a Georgian Crescent as a building dating from 1816.The Castle is the home of the local Teachers Centre and much of the interior has been preserved as it would have been in the 19th century. Recently a local theatre group presented "The Merry Wives of Windsor" in the grounds of the Castle. Why then is such a building known as "The Castle"?At the time of the Norman Conquest Wisbech commanded a vital river crossing and so William the Conqueror ordered a castle to be built in 1087.Since then it ha been destroyed by flood,dismantled,the prison for Gunpowder Plotters,a Bishop's Palace and a mansion before becoming the Regency Villa seen today.
